newsitem.title: POLAND: Krosno expects 1997 flat at PLN 10.1 mln.
newsitem.headline: Krosno expects 1997 flat at PLN 10.1 mln.

text.p: Polish glassmaker Krosno SA expects its 1997 net profit to stay flat at 10.1 million zlotys because of a deteriorating economic climate for exporters, the company said in a statement on Thursday.
Krosno said an increase in profits would be hard to achieve despite an expected increase of sales to 213 million zlotys next year from 179.7 million in 1996.

The inflation-driven growth of costs was seen at 15 percent in the overall economy next year and at between 18 and 20 percent for some raw materials, while zloty devaluation against a basket of foreign currencies was forecast at five percent, it said.

"The pace of zloty devaluation is not fast enough to make up for the growth of domestic prices (of raw materials). With 50 percent of export, such a policy...is a barrier for further intensive growth of the company," it said.
Krosno said it did not plan to lower its exports because of low demand of the domestic market for its products.
